intro: Ranunculus sintenisii, commonly known as the Sintenis' buttercup, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically features simple, palmately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers with numerous stamens. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
